titleStmt.title: Von Ludwig Wittgenstein an George Edward Moore, [7. 5. 1914]
titleStmt.author: Wittgenstein, Ludwig

sourceDesc.p: Original bei Timothy Moore; Kopie im BA. Publiziert (Letters, S. 150; deutsch: Briefe, S. 55; Cambridge Letters, S. 85f.; WiC, S. 73).

list.item: 2007/06: Conversion from Folio Flat File to XML

div.p: Your letter annoied me. When I wrote Logik I didn't consult the Regulations, & therefore I think it would only be fair if you gave me my degree without consulting them so much either! As to a Preface & Notes; I think my examiners will easily see how much I have cribbed from Bosanquet. ‒ If I'm not worth your making an exception for me even in some stupid details then I may as well go to Hell directly; and if I am worth it & you don't do it then ‒ by God ‒ you might go there.
The whole business is too stupid & too beastly to go on writing about it so ‒
